name: R&D Deep Scan
description: Total newbie deck I've made from my single core and expansions but have not lost yet with. A relentless attack on R&D basically.

name: Project Loomheid v1.0
description:
This deck is about robbing the runner of their actions while using give the Corp additional actions. Largest Weakness is the cost of the ice and a lot of ice of similar types. Inspired by build from Team Covenant Jintecki Deck. http://teamcovenant.com/4math/2013/04/01/jintetricks-replicating-perfections-focus/

I currently only have access to 1 Core Set, What lies Ahead, Trace Amounts, A Study in Static.

name: Cerebral Damaging
description:
So here's my attempt at making a Brain Damage deck in Cerebral Imaging. Pretty much a copy of x3r0h0ur's HB Brainbuster deck, with some changes (maybe for the worst). I took Heimdall 1.0 instead of its bigger cousin to ensure I can rez them with the economy in the deck. Basic gameplan is to ice up centrals and a remote and keep baiting the runner with Cerebral Overwriter and Haas Arcology AI or to try to score out wtih agendas. Neural EMP for the flat-line once the runner has suffered some brain damage.

I might go with another route with the deck, with Biotic Labors for the FA scoring and more focus on Operation Econs and making centrals with brain damage tax.

I still have 2 unused influence, not sure what to use them with. Maybe 2 Lotus Field or maybe another Inazuma?

Let me know what you think and what ways I can refine the deck!

name: [beta/concept] I can make that work....
description:
Drawing inspiration from Over Knight by Alsciende and Damon Stone talking about not spending credits to break subroutines, I wanted to make a build that tried this concept as often as possible. Exile seems like the choice, because of the free card draw, kate would possibly be equally beneficial, but the idea is that money isn't the issue.

The economy: Since we're not breaking subroutines for dollars most of the time (bypassing still counts with femme :/), money can run in the 'build a rig' range of cash. So, aesops based econ with Daily casts and armitage, bolstered by lucky find and SG should be perfectly fine. Supplement draw with money with Pro Con and we should be good.

The breaker package Overmind breaks everything, and saves counters with GHook and D4v1d. D4v1d takes care of wraparound (worst use), and the big boys. Both D4v1d and OM like ghook to make them more better. LLDS reduces breaking costs further by taking care of "one to pump" and adds a fallback aesops target if cash just isn't showing up. Same old thing is in the deck to trigger levy in bad situations, and scavenge femme around in good situations. Test run femme + scavenge is always a great play in shaper, you can't have enough copies with Exile in the mix (gets you a card every time!).

Extras As the game goes on and the ice layers, the toolbox helps do some heavy lifting giving you more counters on our guy OM, and 2 credits to go along with the LLDS money savings. SMC and clonechip help find the one-shots (Deus and SharpShooter, as well as D4v1d and Ghook when you can't draw them). D4v1d might be better as faerie, and just run tinkering, but I'm not sold on that yet.

Are the cost savings of spending tokens to break subroutines enough to merit consideration? Is Slysquid right that Aesop's is an awesome econ card? I think the answer to these, and many more questions, is an emphatic, YES!

Changes? If money is more rampant than I expect, I might consider putting in some cybersolutions memchips, maybe even in place of the akamatsus!

Prepaid voicepad? Probably not unless it goes the Kate route.

Multiaccess? Definitely a needed component, if the base package works, then we can work on multi access facets. If lucky find seems to be 'too much' I might put in 3 legwork, and find slots for indexing, TME, or RDI.

name: Retrashable mk 1.4
description:
Many iterations since initial modification from db0's untrashable. Ends up really as a cross between db0's deck, and the RP Glacier deck on Stimhack from Medio, which 99.99% is the better deck as while I go into topdeck mode, that deck can use a Nisei that is scored for the win.

The deck went into three very clear stages. First stage is to tax the runner, get assets down, use Jacksons to dump all agendas into archives to shuffle back in. Second stage is setting up the first scoring out of hand, which is amassing credits, amassing four advancement counters on Ice Wall for Trick of Light. If the runner hasn't scored a Medical, then Trick of Light + Sansan is needed. As soon as the Sansan is rezzed, it needs the Wall of Thorns of Susanoo above it, along with a Caprice, all to protect it, with the credits to back it up.

This deck failed too readily to Whizzard decks, as he ignores the asset trash tax, and is able to apply pressure early enough that the second stage never really happens, which means the critical mass of credits needed to pump out agendas doesn't occur either. That, and being a slower deck to play meant I switched to other decks in the interim.

name: An Eventful Night For a Spy
description: Control the tempo of the corp with the runner ID, Logos, and Gorman Drip. Drill the HQ when you're comfortable with the HQ Interfaces and Legwork, using Executive Wiretaps to ensure that you're not running on a hand with no goodies. If necessary to access the HQ, use Inside Job + False Echo or Crescentus to clear expensive ice out of the picture. If playing against Jinteki or HB, you might want to use Logos to tutor the Lemuria Codecracker to prevent yourself from getting burnt. In any case, focus on locking down the HQ while preventing the corp from advancing too fast.

name: Iaijutsu Hasbro
description:
I originally created this deck as a joke. I took inspiration from many similar Cerebral Imaging + Trick of Light decks, but decided to create one that would take adventage of full-deck Power Shutdown. I was extremely surprised to find that this deck actually managed to win multiple games. Note that to start the combo you need to have at least 10 credits and a full hand (of good cards) and even then you need a lot of practice to nail it down. Have fun, example combo start below.

  1. Biotic Labor (just one will do)
  2. Mirrormorph (puts any combination of Committee and Jackson)
  3. Power Shutdown the entire deck
  4. use Jackson to shuffle on 2x.SanSan and Interns (or anything else instead of interns)
  5. Accelerated Diagnostics to play all 3 cards for free
  6. San San Shipments instant-score Committee, use to it get 3 clicks
  7. repeat the above in small variations

Important: it is possible to improve this deck a lot with newer cards, the list you can see is limited strictly to paper cards I own. (One of the reasons I have only 2 Kaguya's.)

name: Targeted Hate
description:
Using the German Nationals Tagging NBN deck ICE spread, I try to include the 8-card Control package of Targeted Marketing, Data Hound, Invasion of Privacy for when the Runners poor and it will go off, and 1x Snoop for that surprise pull.

In lieu of not tagging, added 2x WilloWisp to create windows if I can't make one with SanSan.

Nothing too creative here, just trying these 8 cards for controlling the Runners cards before I get too crazy.

Poor deck, overall cheap ICE, and will rely on getting off a Targeted Marketing.

name: The Root of All Evil
description: Typical Weyland deck. Scorched combo, some advancable ICE, lots and lots of econ. Added Paywall Implementation because you gain a free credit just from playing it with BABW identity and it's great for building up to that SEA-Scorch-Scorch. Also added The Root to help advance some of the tricky things like Swarm.

name: Operating In The Red
description: Yet another fun danger-tempting experimental deck. This is a Caissa-inspired credit-denial deck. I'll write more about it later.

name: NBN Tagging News
description: Updated List for Krystman from Teamwork Cast ;).
